job.title: Software Engineer I
job.description: strongSoftware Engineer I  Brain Science brbrstrongThe strongmissionstrong of the strongAllen Institutestrong is to unlock the complexities of bioscience and advance our knowledge to improve human health Using an open science multiscale teamoriented approach the strongAllen Institutestrong focuses on accelerating foundational research developing standards and models and cultivating new ideas to make a broad transformational impact on sciencebrbrThe mission of the Allen Institute for Brain Science is to accelerate the understanding of how the human brain works in health and disease Using a big science approach we generate useful public resources drive technological and analytical advances and discover fundamental brain properties through integration of experiments modeling and theorybrbrThe Allen Institute for Brain Science seeks a Software Engineer to develop applications and open scientific databases that serve neuroscience and brain imaging research communities around the world Your colleagues will contribute high volume scientific experiments to your databases scientific computer vision and other numerical software to process those data and web applications that enable users to navigate search and visualize the data productsbrbrThe successful candidate will join a team of developers responsible for the databases services and APIs that support computational neuroscientists the Institutes laboratory information management system LIMS and web application products You will interact with neuroscientists and a wide variety of engineers collaborating in a large team working on new discoveries about the brain Our team uses popular modern software tools and cloud servicesbrbrResponsibilities of this position include designing and developing software writing unit tests reviewing your peers code documenting APIs and demonstrating your workbrbrThe Allen Institute believes that team science significantly benefits from the participation of diverse voices experiences and backgrounds Highquality science can only be produced when it includes different perspectives We are committed to increasing diversity across every team and encourage people from all backgrounds to apply for this rolebrbrstronguEssential Functionsbrustrongulli Contribute to the development and maintenance of scientific databases and applications lili Collaborate effectively with experts in diverse scientific and engineering topics neuroscience high performance scientific computing computer vision web applications lili Apply modern software engineering workflow including emphasis on code review continuous integration and automated testing brliulNote Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions This description reflects managements assignment of essential functions it does not proscribe or restrict the tasks that may be assignedbrbrstronguRequired Education And Experiencebrustrongulli Proficiency in at least one general purpose objectoriented language Python C Java Ruby C lili Proficiency in SQL lili Proficiency with Git for source code management lili Bachelors degree or equivalent experience in a relevant technical discipline brliulstronguPreferred Education And Experiencebrustrongulli Familiarity with API design and development lili Familiarity with RESTful web services lili Familiarity with or a deep desire to learn software development tools and utilities for the Linux platform lili Familiarity with DevOps software such as Ansible Terraform or Cloud Formation lili Familiarity with Docker or Kubernetes lili Familiarity with cloud services such as AWS GCP or Azure lili Familiarity with NoSQL databases such as Neo4J or MongoDB lili Familiarity with an agile project management framework such as Kanban or Scrum lili Familiarity with continuous integration and continuous delivery workflows including build systems and infrastructure as code IaC brliulstrong Physical Demands brstrongulli Fine motor movements in fingershands to operate computers and other office equipment repetitive motion with lab equipment brliulstrong Position TypeExpected Hours of Work brstrongulli Occasional evening hours required lili This role is currently able to work remotely due to COVID19 and our focus on employee safety We are a Washington State employer and remote work must be performed in Washington State We continue to evaluate the safest options for our employees As restrictions are lifted in relation to COVID19 this role will return to work onsite brliulIt is the policy of the Allen Institute to provide equal employment opportunity EEO to all persons regardless of age color national origin citizenship status physical or mental disability race religion creed gender sex sexual orientation gender identity andor expression genetic information marital status status with regard to public assistance veteran status or any other characteristic protected by federal state or local law In addition the Allen Institute will provide reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities
